definition: to tear at (with the teeth, like one animal attacking another)

sentences.english: It shows a fox being disembowelled by a pack of hounds.
sentences.chinese: 画面中一只狐狸正被一群猎狗撕咬得肠子外流。

sentences.english: When a lion bites a urus, you will say how wild and cruel.
sentences.chinese: 人常说动物凶猛，说狮子杀死野牛的撕咬是多么残忍。

sentences.english: Tamed Drywallow Snappers now will know Bite 5 (instead of Claw 5.
sentences.chinese: 被驯服的尘泥钳嘴鳄鱼将会习得撕咬5，而非爪击5。

sentences.english: The mouse’s tearing the blouse and trousers aroused the housewife’s anger.
sentences.chinese: 老鼠撕咬短衫和裤子激起了主妇的怒火。

sentences.english: I said ignore the finishers, so that removes Rip and FB.
sentences.chinese: 我说过忽略掉终结技，那么移除了割裂和凶猛撕咬。

sentences.english: The two dogs struggled for a bone.
sentences.chinese: 两条狗为争一块骨头撕咬了起来。

sentences.english: The two animals fought, relentlessly tearing at each other’s flesh.
sentences.chinese: 两只动物撕杀起来，彼此毫不留情地撕咬着对方的肉。

sentences.english: During a fight dogs usually bite one another to the necks.
sentences.chinese: 在打架比赛中，狗经常会互相撕咬颈部。

definition: to charge/to pounce on/to swoop down on
to attack with a bladed weapon
to fight together/to come to blows
to be drenched with blood/dripping blood
